Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: haigh119
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend break with another couple. The hotel itself is adequate if all you want to do is sleep there. The bathrooms were huge and clean, although ours only had a shower. OUr bedroom was quite small and dark, but the beds were confi and to say the hotel is on a main road, we didnt hear any traffic. The hotel is located next to the monumental metro stop, which is a little out of the centre (about 30 mins walk to Las Ramblas). The Sagrada Familia is visible from the hotel and nice to stroll up to to have breakfast with some lovely views. I would recommend this hotel if you dont mind the extra bit of walking or jumping in a taxI (around 6 euros from Las Ramblas). If I return to Barcelona I would look for a hotel more central

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break!”
Reviews.Author: kate006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on a weekend break to Barcelona, we got a really good deal on hotels.com and the hotel seemed central. We weren't disappointed when we arrived, the hotel is very modern and had a boutique feel. We were there in February, and the room was clean and very nice. The location was pretty much beside the Monumental metro stop and therefore getting around Barcelona was easy. The Sagrada Familia is within a short walk. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We walked into the main areas during the day, it probably took about 25 minutes or so. I'm sure there are more convenient locations to the main tourist areas but you would pay a lot more. I was happy with the hotel for a short stay and it was good value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay with a beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: StuLloyd72
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of things that make staying at this hotel a real joy but the main one that sticks in my mind is the view of Sagrada Familia from our balcony. We were staying on the 8th floor in a junior suite but paying the extra money was worth it just to wake up each morning, open the curtains and see the amazing expression of Gaudi's brilliance. The hotel is amost next door to the Monumental metro stop and therefore getting around Barcelona is very easy. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. We also had room service breakfast one morning, the food was tasty and we certainly had enough to eat The room itself was ideal for a short stay, was very clean and the air conditioning (or in this case heating, it was February) worked perfectly. The bathroom was well set out and the shower was great. All in all the hotel added to what was a perfect holiday in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Still looking for the 4th star”
Reviews.Author: lleidatana43
Reviews.Content: To list some positive aspects about this hotel, its location is really convenient and there is a large choice at the breakfast buffet. Also, breakfast is served until 11.00 on weekdays, which worked nicely for us night birds. Plus the girl at the reception, who seemed to be permanently living there, was really friendly. But that's about it. We've stayed in several hotels in Barcelona in the past couple of years, and this one is definitely not on our list of places to go back to. Our room was tiny and poorly kept and, as other reviewers have mentioned, we could hear everything that went on in our neighbours' rooms. The bathroom was large but it had no heating - therefore, whenever we left the door closed during the night, it was freezing the next morning. The water pressure of the shower was poor, despite the very loud noise it made, which we feared would wake up all the neighbours. The worst thing about our stay, however, was the cleaning service. There were dust bunnies on corners, stains on the bed covers (which never seemed to be replaced) and the towels were a suspicious shade of grey that I wouldn't expect of a four-star hotel. We had booked the romantic package they list on their website, which included a bottle of cava that we couldn't drink down in one go, so the next morning it was removed from our room without as much as a word. That's what I call bad service.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend and will come back - just a very few flaws compared to usual standard in Spanish hotels”
Reviews.Author: Lucie81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is as stylish as it appears on the pictures. The rooms are rather small but in a cute and comfortable way. The bathrooms are in fact rather spacious. Generally, the hotel is very very clean which in Spain is certainly not a standard (trust me, I have been living in Spain and travelling around as much as a can). For those who hate the system of a sheet and a blanket usual in Southern countries I emphasize - here they have proper "funda nordica", no sheets and no weird blankets. And the bed covers are changed every day.Apart from minibar fridge, there is a kettle and some tea, coffee, sugar and cream and tea cups. Although the hotel windows isolate the traffic from outside very well, the isolation between the rooms really could be better. It is not that you would hear the guests nextdoor breathing, but you e.g. hear when the cleaning lady in the morning walks around and moves the beds to change the covers. Especially closing the other bedrooms doors is somehow too hearable, although the clients of the hotel are not of a society group that would seem suspiccious to you, be generally making noise, shouting loud at the corrdidors and bounce the doors. The opposite. But it is much much better than many hotels I have slept in in my life. It is no drama. It just one of the very little things to mention if finding some weak side of the hotel at all. Therefore think next time Hotasa group would be reconstructing a hotel, they could really invest yet a bit more into the isolations between the rooms, the quality is not always and only about the fashionable design. Otherwise, I loved the place, I loved the matrace although many people say it is too hard - it was a really nice quality matrace (and cushions) am wondering what their backbones say if they are used to sleep in soft beds? It is not healthy at all.. Regarding the district, it is not in the imminent center center, but do not regret it at all, Eixample derecha belongs among two cosiest parts of the city and is much more quiter than Rambla etc. It is 50 metres max from the metro which runs every 3 minutes or so, and mere 2 stops to get on Placa Catalunya/Rambla/Cathedral...(get out on Passeig de Gracia). And it is 5 minutes walking distance from Sagrada Familia. It is also a very convenient place if you came to see some concert in L,Auditori. I strongly recommend you to go have a Pilsner Urquell beer and meal to Czech bar, Pivobar which is bit further than Sagrada Familia, but not more than 10 minutes walk. The girls bake homemade bread, cook traiditional meals and always have such treats us Czechs usually have with beer in a pub, such as utopence, nakladany hermelin and even tlacenka. There also is a Polish shop close to S.F., offering all the best from our Slavonic groceries.

Reviews.Title: “Quick stopover in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine, walls are a bit thin so I could hear people in the room next door. The room was fine for me, it was clean, modern and everything worked as it should. Great location close Segrada Familia and metro just down the road. Some nice places to eat very close and did not see any evidence of any security concerns in the general area. Expect to pay 30+ euro for taxi fare to / from airport, I would use the train next time.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Annikken M Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: Nicely decorated small rooms, with noisy overlooking streets with lots of traffic. If you prefer to skip aircondition and open the window at night, bring airplugs. Where are the balkony on the picture? Is it for the top suite? We never saw a balcony. Near metro, and a few stops to the center of town. Metro is a fantastic experience. Very near sagrada de familia, which is fantastic I would choose another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “This one is a keeper”
Reviews.Author: blakcloud
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. I tend to like hotels not in the center of downtown as they are to noisy. I like hotels just slightly outside the hustle and bustle and this one fit the bill. First it is right on the subway line which makes traveling around Barcelona very easy. It is also near Sagrada Familia which is handy at the same time it has a neighbourhood feel. So you have conveniences like bakeries, small shops and restaurants. The hotel is 8 stores and only has 6 rooms per floor. This make it a very quiet hotel, since there are less people. You also don't have to wait in line to pay, pick up your keys etc. You get that one to one service which is nice. The room was great. Nicely decorated though the bed was not the most comfortable. The bathroom is huge and one of the nicest bathrooms for a hotel. It was also very clean and house keeping did a great job for the three days we were there. I would most definitely stay here again if I go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good find for a short break in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: vicky_b_09
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after seeing an offer for it on Travel Zoo's weekly e-mail. It took us a little while to find (we got off at a subway station which was miles away instead of the one that was a few yards away from the hotel itself). We found the hotel to be very smartly decorated but the room to be quite small which also meant that the room got very warm at times! There was a strange window in the room - we weren't sure whether it was broken or just opened at an odd angle to save space. Apart from this, the room was comfy with free tea/coffee and a minibar. The subway, as previously mentioned, is a few yards away as is the Sagrada Familia and a host of restaurants and cafes. There is only a short walk to the main shopping/dining/entertainment areas in Barcelona (e.g. Las Ramblas) so for the price this hotel seems ideal for a city break! On our final day the hotel were having some issues with the level of chlorine in the water which we had noticed as the smell was getting stronger and stronger. However repairmen arrived on our last day so i will put this down to maintenance! All in all a good stay in a value for money hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for the price.”
Reviews.Author: alisonveritas32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week and while it certainly won't blow you away, it's perfectly acceptable for a clean, safe hotel within walking distance or close public transport to all major attractions. Booked last minute in the peak of tourist season, and it was still very reasonably priced. Staff is practically non-existent though and there is no such thing as a lobby bar or restaurant (although they say there is - you have to ring the front desk and wait for the one person who seems to work there to answer a question or get you a coffee. The staff needs to be increased or given a raise given that the same person seems to do everything! No frills hotel and spotty wifi, but if you're sight-seeing and just need a clean, comfortable place to sleep at night it is perfectly fine. Caution for those who really care about this - we requested a non-smoking room and the first night we arrived late and when we walked in our room it smelled heavily of smoke. My friend is very sensitive to it so we immediately went down and asked about it. Sorry, no more rooms and they said it was no-smoking room. Ok, back up, and right there is an ashtray and matches. Um.....too bad, no more rooms that night but they did move us to another room the next day which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with helpful service”
Reviews.Author: daggerdaglish
Reviews.Content: we really hit lucky here - they gave us a top floor room, with balcony and amazing view of city. Room was large, clean as was the bathroom. Bed was a little hard but not end of world. Service from reception was great - we had an emergency and they really helped us!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Metro station and La Sagrada Familia”
Reviews.Author: Orion3377
Reviews.Content: Eurostars Gaudi is located near the Monumental Metro Station in Eixample. This area is a bit quieter than Las Ramblas, but with the Metro so close (on the same block), you can go just about anywhere you need to. The Metro is quick, clean, and cheap! The hotel is a boutique hotel with a small lobby that doubles as the breakfast area. (I did not try it out.) The desk staff were all friendly and a few spoke English. There was one computer station available--free WiFi in the rooms. There were about six rooms on each floor. The first three were quite close to the elevator which made those rooms a bit noisier. I requested a quiet room and was given one further from the elevator. However, the walls were so thin, the neighbors could easily be heard and their cigarette smoke filtered through. The floors are hardwood in the rooms so footsteps can be heard as well. This will interrupt your sleep. Even though there were busy streets outside, the windows filtered the noise well. The furnishings were fine. The beds were a bit hard and the pillows flat. The bathroom was clean and updated but the shower had trouble maintaining the same temperature. Good closet with shelves for storage.The room temperature can be adjusted with the thermostat. (A/C worked.) La Sagrada Familia is a short ten minute walk away. More restaurants in that area. Close to the hotel: a pharmacy, a small grocery store, and several small restaurant/bars. Also the Monumental Bullring. Bullfighting in Barcelona will end in 2012. If you like to ride bikes there is a Bicing rental rack outside the hotel. Get the best room rate on the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “A monumental mistake”
Reviews.Author: onionboy
Reviews.Content: Firstly i would like to say what a great city Barcelona is. It was one of the greatest places i have ever visited. Everyone seemed so friendly and there was so much to do. Would definitely visit the city again. I have to admit however, i was not massively impressed with the hotel. Upon arrival, we had to move rooms, as our room had a faulty shower and a terrible smell. We moved to the same type of room, but on a different floor. The caretaker who came to look at the room was quite rude. She said nothing as she entered the room and told reception there was no smell. Which was incorrect! The room was VERY small and seemed cluttered. The slightest noise in the corridor at night could be heard in the room. This and the ridiculous amount of traffic outside that went on for the whole night meant that i got very little sleep. The rooms were also incredibly hot and stuffy. Another gripe was that the bath had no plug. I had to wait half an hour for a plug to be delivered to my room. A small thing but quite an inconvenience. . The receptionist upon arrival was very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was excellent. Right by the excellent Metro. For the money we spent on this hotel i would not come here again. There were good points about the hotel, but for me they were outweighed by the poor room/heat/noise etc. The trip was a success due to the wonderful city and the special person i shared the holiday with.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, comfortable and well-designed rooms”
Reviews.Author: Katrin_Klein
Reviews.Content: Liked: We realy liked the hotel and its design. Room was clean, personel - nice and helpful, breakfast - fresh and various. Metro station is right next to the hotel which is very comfortable, but you also can walk 10-15 min to the Sagrada Familia. Disliked: We booked a Romantic Offer and were very surprised that can't get a double room with bath. Unfortunately there were just next options - twin room with bath or double room with shower OR we had to pay more to get a double bed with bath in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great views but not too large or centralized”
Reviews.Author: travelnut718
Reviews.Content: Found a really great deal for this hotel online... was very clean, bed and bathroom were gorgeous but the room was on the smaller size. It did have a spectacular view of La Sagrada Familia and close to the train/bus... not too close to the action but Barcelona is a beautiful city to walk around in aimlessly so this wasn't a problem for us

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is very small. Staff is nice but...”
Reviews.Author: Smackola
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very small. Staff is nice but not overly helpful. Close to a good metro line. Rooms were not great, clean but tasteless, more of a three star variety. Some minor maintenance issues. Overall if u can get a good rate I'd stay but I wouldn't consider the hotel a 4 star. Closer to 3.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, stunning views”
Reviews.Author: Rubybuttons
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in August. Would definately reccomend it. To anyone wanting to arrive at the hotel with minimum struggle, the metro that is just outside is the MONUMENTAL stop! If only we'd known this prior to arrival!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but...”
Reviews.Author: chanthird
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for two nights in August 2010. We arrived at the hotel around 12pm. The front desk staff was friendly. The very first question she asked was if we wanted to upgrade our room for an additional 30 euro per night. After we told her no she assigned us a room on the 1st floor (#105). The room was good, and the decor was nice and modern. However, the bathroom is was in bad shape. The bathroom has two sinks. On one of the sinks the hot water would not turn on, and the other sink had a continuous drip which caused a yellow stain in the sink. The mirror was very old with a brown ring around the entire edge of the mirror. The bidet was missing the nozzle, which left a rusted screw sticking out of it, but the shower was the worse! The tile was very old and needed to be pressured washed or replaced. I felt like I needed shower shoes to touch the shower floor. The handheld shower head did not mount on the wall, so you could not stand under the water, only hold the nozzle. There were 6 round pressure nozzles in the shower that water came out of, but when you turn them on the water went everywhere. You couldn’t adjust these nozzles up or down, so you either got the entire bathroom wall and door wet or used the handheld device. This hotel is very close to the Sagrada Família and about a 30 minute walk to the harbor and beach. However, I would not stay at this hotel again because of the bathroom! I felt like once we didn’t agree to upgrade we were given and older room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...just one complaint”
Reviews.Author: i_heart_vaykays
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Very comfortable beds. Nice bathroom. Fantastic staff. Just a few steps to the metro. Very close to Sagrada Familia, shops, cafes, etc. My only complaint is that the internet didn't work the entire time we were there. I booked the hotel in part because of the free internet for guests. It was a feature I expected and might've picked a different hotel had I known we would not be able to use the internet in our room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: 01nicky
Reviews.Content: Hard to find, with a very anonomus facade. The hotel is just 100 meters from the metro, also near buses. Close to the market. We didn't try the hotels breakfast, so we can't say anything about that. The room was with a modern touch and very nice, the view to Sagrada Familie was nice. Very good value for money. We will definately use the hotel again, if we go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, very well located, Subway in front of the door”
Reviews.Author: zenitlongarb
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very Nice, just 5m from the Sagrada Familia Cathedral. The Subway entrance is just in front of the Hotel door. It has free internet access on the Looby, the rooms are very nice with a great view to the sagrada Familia. Defenitly recommended

Reviews.Title: “A best bet in Barcelona...clean, comfortable, and affordable”
Reviews.Author: PE1968
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real treat. It's in a great location, just blocks away from la sagrada familia and steps away from the metro stop. It's very comfortable, modern and affordable. This was my first time staying at Eurostars and I am sold. Plasma tv, free wifi and environmental controls (no power if you're not in the room) are great extras that impressed me.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: SushieG
Reviews.Content: We got an amazingly cheap deal on our room at wotif.com, otherwise would not have fit this into our budget! The large room was gorgeous, with beautiful furnishings, art and a great modern bathroom. (could not work out how to use massage setting in shower!) We had a view of the Sagrada Familia. Located on a long, busy street, there was plenty of food and shopping around, but not so much going on at night that we were kept awake. Staff were lovely and accommodating. Would definitely recommend this place to friends!

Reviews.Title: “CAN'T WAIT TO RETURN AND STAY THERE AGAIN !!!”
Reviews.Author: lasrambla
Reviews.Content: I couldn't fault the hotel at all. Ideally located for for l'Eixample, Sagrada and the old town. Hotel appears anonymous from the oustside but that belies the quality of the rooms, which i found first class. Didn't have a balcony but that didn't really matter. Room was modern, tastefully furnished (i have paid a lot more for rooms with far less style !!), spotlessly clean and as well as having first rate air con, the windows can be opened for fresh air. The buffet breakfast was just right. I couldn't fault my stay there and wil shall definately stay at the Gaudi when i next return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall - would stay there again that sums it up!!”
Reviews.Author: HAllybacus
Reviews.Content: Wasn't quite sure what to expect but was more than pleasantly suprised!! Excellent location - 50 metres from Monumental station & Sagrada Familia around the corner and loads of local restaurants. Away from the touristy areas so safer and cleaner in my opinion Service - great, friendly english very well spoken Room - Excellent for the price booked for more than 3 nights so the average price was £60/night, would have been useful to have tea/coffee in the room though. Very clean as well If i can stay there for £60/night I would jump at it again......Barcelona has got more expensive in the last few years but that's out of the hotel's control!

Reviews.Title: “Location ideal for Sagrada”
Reviews.Author: graynz
Reviews.Content: Hotel a short walk to Sagrada Familia which was our main reason to visit Barcelona. The hotel receptionist was especially friendly & obliging, changing our room to a larger size on the 7th floor with Sagrada views. We liked that we could open the windows and have fresh air rather than sealed windows & air conditioning. Is on a busy corner but we had an unexpected ideal view of the Tour de France from our window. Anita & Maurice Gray (NZ)

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with stay”
Reviews.Author: xjewelersx
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect after reading so many Barcelona hotel reviews. Stayed one night here. Saw the Tour de France come right down the street from our hotel room. Very good location for seeing Sagrada Familia church. Too far from Las Ramblas and other tourists. Room was small, as most European rooms. A/C worked fine, room was clean upon arrival. English speaking front desk. Free WiFi. Got exactly what we reserved - double bed, non-smoking. Could hear people from the hall way, but just when they walked through, wasn't a problem. Shower only. Toiletries provided. Room to hang clothes and put a suitcase. Desk in room. Window opened.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay at Eurostars Gaudi.”
Reviews.Author: DerbysTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in the run up to Easter 09. Hotel staff are friendly (even the cleaners smile and say 'hola!'), helpful and efficient. The rooms are reasonably sized, well decorated and well maintained. We didn't have a bath in the ensuite, but the 7-nozzle shower made up for that! The rooms do face onto a pretty busy intersection, but are soundproof against most things (although not emergency vehicle sirens, as I discovered in the small hours - wasn't an issue at all but probably wouldn't recommend for light sleepers). Think it was an exceptional 3-star rather than a 4-star but the 'last-minute' deal was still worth it! Location wise it is a bit out of the centre - about five minutes from Sagrada Familia and literally 100 yards from Monumental Metro station (which is great for Passeig de Gracia for the airport train). It's not in a 'plush' area but we never felt anything other than comfortable even late in the evening. Not many places to eat in the immediate area, although quiet a few bars towards / past the Sagrada. Would stay here again, it was a solid 'good'. General Barcelona tips - if you're travelling by train from Barcelona Airport, get a T10 ticket - they're 7.70 for 10 trips in "Zone 1" (which includes all of Barcelona city out to the airport), any trip lasts 1h15 including whichever train, metro, tram or bus you get on in that time - AND they can be shared - so if there are 6 of you, just put it through the machines at the station barrier / behind the bus driver 6 times and that's 6 journeys off your card - really cheap compared to buying single tickets and easy too! For food, we found lots of nice tapas bars and restaurants (of varying price but all good quality) in El Born area - especially in the streets around the Santa Maria del Mar church - not near this hotel but worth knowing!

Reviews.Title: “We expected more.”
Reviews.Author: Pulcina
Reviews.Content: My son and me was in EGH for two nights in December. We had difficulty to find the hotel in the evening, as the hotel hasn't any neon signs outside. Receptionists was young and a not warm at all. Our room was very small; there was only one bed-table; no possibility to lock the bathroom door; only one small towel and a big one per person; no complimentary slipers. The room was very noisy during the night, even if we were at the 6th floor and with double windows, as the hotes is situated among three ways with heavy traffic also in the night. But the biggest problem we faced was the terribly hot we had in the room (I believe around 26°) we cannot control from the room an the impossibility to keep open the window, due to the traffic noisy and for the impossibility to open it completely.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel close to metro station”
Reviews.Author: JC_sakura
Reviews.Content: Location-wise I think this hotel is very conveniently located with a metro station just a few steps away. The Sagrada Familia is totally within walking distance (about 15 mins); alternatively it is only one station away if you take the metro. Also, it is a 10-minute taxi ride from Nord bus station which is where you take airport coaches to and from Girona Airport (the Ryan Air airport). The downside is that it is at an intersection of two busy roads so you might have to bear with the noise of the buzzling traffic. The room was fairly modern, but the desks looked pretty dusty (might have something to do with the hotel being situated at the intersection of main roads), and water kept leaking from underneath the sink in our room whenever I turn on the tap. There is also no kettle in the room and it took ages for the hotel staff to bring us hot water. There was free wi-fi in the room but the connection was pretty unstable. If you really need to use the internet, the hotel has a computer down at the lobby. There is obviously room for improvement to keep up to its 4 star rating but service aside if all you need is a modern hotel with a good location, then this is a hotel I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: vanta_8
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 4 days and it was a very pleasand stay.The hotel is in a great location and the building is new with an excellent inside design.The room was big with a lot of space and modern decoration inspired from the major tourist attractions and it was also very well cleaned every day.Breakfast was ok,stuff was helpful and friendly especially the reception.I certainly recoment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Eurostar Gaudi Dec. 2007”
Reviews.Author: BerkeleyBabyBoomer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights beginning Dec.2nd. following a nine day cruise. We took a taxi that had room for four and cruise luggage. The taxis charge by the piece and for a larger minivan. We paid about 30 Euros with tip. While checking in, a member of our party had two carryons stolen by thieves in the lobby at around 9am in the morning. The girl at the desk let two men in the lobby while we were checking in. These men were not guests of the hotel and casually walked in, hung around the area and casually walked out with the carryon luggage before our friend knew what happened. I was involved with checking in and providing passports along with my friend. His wife went to the bathroom and our other friends were looking at the lobby internet and reading maps so stay vigilant even in the small lobby of a small hotel. The rooms were clean and modern and we had a good view of the circle and the towers of Segrada Familia a few blocks away. There is shower gel, soap, but no shampoo. They have fancy showers but only half partition of glass so flooding is common. The drainage is very slow. The towels smell like vinegar. The flat screen worked but not too many offerings in English. There are no good places to eat around the hotel. We don't like the cafe bars. The food is horrible and expensive. The good restaurants are down toward the Port and La Ramblas. The restaurants and cafes are smoke filled so those allergic, don't go to Barcelona. It seems like most people smoke. We saw many young teenagers smoking like chimneys. We used a two day hop on hop off bus at $23 Euros per person and caught it at the Segrada Familia. The metro was really close by the hotel- Monument station was less than a block away, 1.5 Euros each way. The Segrada Familia station was near the tourist site about 4 blocks away. Food is expensive, look for menu of the day offerings for value. Our US dollars don't go far in Europe. We enjoyed the Gothic Quarter and Park Guell. We visited some of the other stops and shopped in local districts on the tour bus route. We noticed that the general population and the non-tourist trade shop keepers have different hours from Americans. We get the impression that they don't work many hours a day. There is plenty to see and it will take more than three days to see many of the main sites. We paid 40 Euros for a taxi to the airport for 4 with 8 pieces of luggage. Other than the robbery, our friends enjoyed the Egyptian museum and Picasso Museum. It was an experience-good and bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Dreamstimer
Reviews.Content: This shouldn't be taken for the Gaudi Hotel from La Rambla (which I don't know, just that they are different). Eurostars' Gaudi is 10 minutes walk from Sagrada. If you're lucky you'll view it's roof from the hotel's window. Sagrada is close, but this is not downtown nor the gothic quarter (which is a little bit dirty imo). This is not a central hotel, but it's a quiet neigborhood (for a city). If you want the best of this hotel, ask for one of the rooms with terrace (last floor). They should be much nicer than the rest and bigger (especially if you've seen their website). We stayed in the smallest room, the one near elevators. Those are smaller than the regular ones, but we were OK, it was just a weekend trip. However, if you stay longer, get away from the elevators. The doors are indeed paper sheet, you will be woke up by your neighbors, not by the clock or sun ;) Didn't hear much of the noise on the street, but heard every foot step on the hallway. The hotel is 1 min from the subway station. Very very handy. One issue I noticed is that you will have to switch trains at least once from here, no matter where you head to. Didn't bother me a lot, but worths mentioning. Hotel is clean, furniture was new. A little bit cheap, trying to imitate expensive furniture. It is not... Anyway, better to imitate nice furniture than to have expensive ugly furniture. Didn't have anything to ask to staff so I can't comment. TV stations are not working well, but who needs that in Barcelona? Breakfast is enjoyable here (would be nicer with a view, but the hotel is very small) and there are so many things to do out there. Tip: Definitely go to Barceloneta if you like seafood. Choose any of the 100 fish restaurants there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: alphili
Reviews.Content: The hotel was new and clean. The room was large and had all the mod cons for a 4 start hotel. The staff was helpful and assisted where possible with my friend who was ill. Free internet. The location was also good - 5 minutes from the Sagrada Familia and about a 15-20min minute walk to the Placa Catalunya or else you can get the bus (5mins & 1.25euros) or a taxi for about 4euros. The only downside is that there isn't alot of eateries around the hotel. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Weekend Spoiled”
Reviews.Author: dschungelhoschi
Reviews.Content: Overall a hotel with very nice rooms. However, not acceptable as a 4 star hotel (this is what you pay at the end of the day) Rooms - very nice and clean - TV was not working - Minibar was not refilled - soap, shower gel and body lotion was not refilled. Again, if one goes into a 4 star hotel one should not have to buy hygienic accessories in the supermarket next door Breakfast: - unfortunately only 2 kinds of sausages, 2 different cheeses - no eggs - no coffee and no tee at 10:30 a.m (although we were told, breakfast is until 11 a.m.) This was clearly not acceptable for a 4 Star hotel. Also, we paid 12 euro per person for this "meal". Service - we have complained but were not given any feedback - some reception staff (not all !!) were really rude Again, very nice rooms (size, look etc.) but everything else in our opinion is not even 3 star, i.e. you don't get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: stellaKent
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel - room was lovely and clean and had good soundproofing considering its on the corner of some busy roads!! Its not far from Sagrada Famailia and we could see it from our room. The bathroom was lovely with an amazing power shower. I can not fault this hotel at all. We didn't have breakfast so can't comment on that although maybe a little expensive at 12 euros! Its also very close to the Metro although we didn't use it. We did walk from La Ramblas and it took about 20 minutes. On the other hand we didn't particularly like Barcelona it was very expensive and also way too crowded but i guess the time of year didn't help. If you like busy busy busy and queuing then this is the place for you! We were so glad we chose this great hotel to come back too at the end of the day!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jewelianna
Reviews.Content: A truly excellent hotel experience. Within walking distance of Sagrada Familia, right next to the Monumental Metro station. Room was clean, not big, but very classy with a wall-mounted plasma TV and mural featuring one of Gaudi's buildings. The shower had multiple spray jets and a full marble bathroom. There is free internet in the lobby. Staff spoke excellent English and were very helpful with directions, mailing postcards, etc. Room was quiet and had a great view of the Gran Via and Cathedral. Definitely a great choice for a stay in Barcelona.

HotelInfo.Address: Consell de Cent 498-500, 08013 Barcelona, Spain
